description: Wheat is among the oldest and most important of the cereal crops, cultivated worldwide for its grain, a staple food in many cultures. It has been a fundamental food source for thousands of years and plays a critical role in human diet and agriculture.

planting_information.optimal_planting_time: Autumn for Winter Wheat, Spring for Spring Wheat

geographic_location.region: North America, Europe, Asia, and Australia

watering_requirements.frequency: As needed, depending on weather conditions
watering_requirements.amount: Varies with soil type and weather conditions, generally 25-35 mm per week

fertilizer_type.name: Nitrogen
fertilizer_type.application_rate: 50-100 kg/ha at planting, with possible additional top dressing

fertilizer_type.name: Potassium
fertilizer_type.application_rate: Varies based on soil test results

harvesting_information.harvest_time: Late spring to early summer for Winter Wheat; Summer for Spring Wheat
harvesting_information.indicators: Grain moisture content 12-14%, change in grain color to golden brown

market_information.market_price: Varies by region and market conditions
market_information.demand_trends: Stable demand, with fluctuations based on global production variations
